# Evaluating your automated analyses {#evaluating}

Regardless of whether you are using LENA or the ACLEW tools, it's always a good idea to check how accurate automated analyses are in your dataset. Here's a demonstration of this:
<!--insert table-->

This graph shows the correlation between human and automated word counts for several corpora, all of which were collected from English-speaking families with infants between roughly 1 and 3 years of age. The correlations, however, vary quite a bit, particularly in the ACLEW tool called ALICE (yellow bars).
